summary: Boise is the capital and biggest city in Idaho, with about 235,000 people. It's located in the southwest part of the state, near the borders of Oregon and Nevada. The Boise metropolitan area, also called Treasure Valley, includes five counties and has a population of over 700,000. Downtown Boise is the city's cultural hub, featuring small businesses, high-rise buildings, shops, and restaurants. It's also home to the Idaho State Capitol, the Egyptian Theatre, Boise Art Museum, and Zoo Boise. The city has a strong Basque heritage, showcased in the Basque Block.
title: Boise, Idaho
